cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeast Gulf, forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest and target the upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border, roughly between Port Bolivar, TX, and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Bolivar, TX to west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Texas coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas and Louisiana coastline from San Luis Pass, TX eastward to Ocean Springs, MS, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (2–4 ft forecast for Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible by Wednesday evening; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks slightly west of current forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Galveston Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated 12-inch totals possible Wednesday night–Thursday, producing flash flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands and dangerous rip currents along adjacent beaches.
